trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of Combinatory Treatment with Lycopene/Soy Isoflavone on Glycemic Control and Plasma Lipid Profile in Individuals with Metabolic Syndrome
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Trial in Subjects with Mediterranean and Middle Eastern Ethnicity who have metabolic syndrome to evaluate the efficacy of a Lycopene/Soy Isoflavone nutritional supplement(LaFlavon) 7/50 mg pill taken daily for 3 months compared to placebo on glucose and insulin concentrations in this patient population.

interventions.interventions: to study the effect of dietary supplementation with Lycopene (7mg) and Soy Isoflavones (50 mg), LaFlavon, taken by mouth once a day with food for ninety days on glucose and insulin plasma levels as well as plasma and tissue lipid concentrations in patients with metabolic syndrome.
interventions.comparator: placebo (inactive ingredients), taken orally once a day for 90 days

primaryOutcome.outcome: a improvement in glucose and insulin levels in this patient population (metabolic syndrome) after 90 days of oral intake of LaFlavon (lycopene 7mg/soy isoflavones 50mg) measured by using a standard oral glucose tolerance test.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: timeframe- baseline and 90 days after beginning treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: increased plasma concentration of the phytochemicals lycopene and soy isoflavones after 90 days oral intake of LaFlavon (lycopene 7 mg/ soy isoflavones 50 mg) measured by assessing serum concentration of these phytochemicals.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: timeframe - baseline and 90 days after beginning treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: improvement in Endothelial Progenitor Cell (EPC) and Circulating Endothelial Cell (CEC) count after 90 days oral intake of LaFlavon measured using plasma cell suspension ( buffy coat preparation) and analyzed by flow cytometry.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: timeframe- baseline and 90 days after beginning treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: improvement in adipose tissue function in the regulation of lipid and glucose metabolism after 90 days oral intake of LaFlavon measured using both serum and subcutaneous fat bioptate sampling.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: timeframe- baseline and 90 days after beginning treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: an improvement in the relationship between low-grade systemic inflammation(C-Reactive Protein, hsCRP) and chlamydial titres after 90 days oral intake of LaFlavon measured by both serum and fat bioptate sampling.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: timeframe- baseline and 90 days after beginning treatment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
Meditteranean and Middle Eastern(Arab) men and women between the ages of 18 and 75 (inclusive) who meet the International Diabetic Foundation(IDF) criteria for Metabolic Syndrome
Subjects must have a waist circumference adjusted for ethnicity (men >37in (94cm), women >31.5 in(80cm))
AND must meet two of the four following study criteria:
- Elevated plasma triglyceride level at or > 150mg/dl - Reduced plasma HDL level (HDL cholesterol at or < 40 mg/dl in males, <50 in females - Raised fasting plasma glucose level >100mg/dl - Raised blood pressure(bp) systolic bp>130 mm/Hg diastolic bp > 85 mm/Hg
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Any clinical evidence of type 2 diabetes or any pharmocological treatment for diabetes (any oral anti-hyperglycemic agent).

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Babraham Research Campus Babraham, Cambridge CB22 3AT, UK

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Babraham Research Campus Babraham, Cambridge CB22 3AT, UK

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This clinical trial is designed to explore the role of dietary supplementation with lycopene and soy isoflavones in the improvement of glucose metabolism in patients with metabolic syndrome.
